results.title: Quiet please
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: An explanation of what noise is, where it most commonly occurs, how it affects the human body, and what can be done to reduce or eliminate it by industry and research laboratories

results.title: Quiet crisis
results.brief_description: A dramatised story of a typical cancer case. This film is a plea for an early visit to the doctor by anyone having the slightest suspicion of the disease. Shows that with early treatment by improved methods, cancer may often be cured while delay can prove to be fatal. Note: This film had been viewed by medical experts and it is considered that the treatment portrayed in the film is not in accord with actual treatment as available in Victoria.

results.title: Quiddity tree
results.creator_credit: Marvin Albert Films and Marvin Albert
results.brief_description: This prize winning film is a fantasy about man and nature, in which the inter-relationships of man and his environment are symbolically revealed. Experimental in its treatment, the film carries the message that man must preserve his environment in every way possible - not destroy it.

results.title: Quick rise
results.brief_description: Time lapse photography is used to speed up the action in a town and a twenty storey building goes from ground level to completion in hour minutes. Visual speed is enhanced by a lively Bach piece preformed on a Moog synthesiser.

results.title: Qui? = Who?
results.brief_description:
A car rides off a cliff. The female passenger survives the ordeal, her male companion, the driver does not. The brother of the dead man takes the young woman back to his place. Although he suspects her to have something to do with his brother’s death, he is inexplicably attracted to her. The police recovers the dead body and for a while the suspicions a laid to rest. But the ‘dead man’ reappears not long after 

Credits: Producer, Raymond Danon ; director, Leonard Keigel ; writers, Leonard Keigel, Paul Gegauff ; photography, Jean Bourgoin ; music, Claude Bolling.
Cast: Romy Schneider, Maurice Ronet, Simone Bach, Jacques Duby, Gabriele Tinti.

results.title: Qui Etes-Vous Monsieur Sorge? = Who Are You, Mister Sorge?
results.brief_description:
This war time docudrama is based on real life events. Richard Sorge was from 1935 through 1943 working at the German embassy in Japan. Sorge was also a Russian spy, leaking out secret invasion plans in preparation for the anticipated Soviet takeover of Japan after the war. After his activities were uncovered, people say he was tried and hanged by the Japanese in 1944. Others suspect he may have been exchanged. His faithful secretary thinks Sorge paid for other people’s mistakes. The film attempts to discover the truth by following with great minutiae the last months of Sorge’s life.

Credits: Producer, Jean Cotet ; director, Yves Ciampi ; writers, Yves Ciampi, Rodolphe-Maurice Arlaud ; photography, Emile Villerbue, T. Ubukata ; music, Serge Nigg.
Cast: Thomas Holtzmann, Hans-Otto Meissner, Keiko Kishi, Nadine Basile, Jacques Berthier, Jesse Hahn.

results.title: Quetico
results.creator_credit: Canadian Film Institute and Christopher Chapman
results.brief_description: Quetico Provincial Park in Ontario, an area of over a million acres of unspoiled wilderness, is being preserved as canoe country for present and future generations. The area is as wild and natural today as it was in the 17th century when explorer, trader and voyager passed through in search of furs and discovery.

results.title: Question. Communicate. Close
results.brief_description: Presented by Jo Hall, this video which takes a good Customer Service person and shows them how to be a great Sales Person. Different vignettes have been chosen to demonstrate the major points of a sales role. The focus is on the skills of questioning, communicating, recognising buying signals and closing the sale. In talking about these areas, this program highlights the difference between satisfying a customer enquiry and turning that enquiry into a sale. It is presented in a generic, rather than industry specific, fashion which gives the video broad appeal to a range of industries. Includes a Leaders guide, Participants workbook and Overhead transparencies.

results.title: Question of silence = De Stilte rond Christine M.
results.creator_credit: Sigma Films, Matthijs van Heijningen and Marleen Gorris
results.brief_description: Lauded as one of the key feminist films of the period, ‘Question of silence’ was the first feature film by feminist Dutch filmmaker, Marlene Gorris. 3 women - a housewife, a secretary and a waitress - strangers united by their gender and the resultant oppression that ensues, and by the charge that they collaborated in the unmotivated murder of a male shop keeper. A female psychiatrist is entrusted with proving the women are not of sane mind, as the legal rationale is that they would have to have been insane, why else would they kill a man in an act of random violence? A question that is not asked when the gender roles of victim/offender are reversed. The psychiatrist is met by resistance in the women, silence in fact. One chooses not the speak, the other speaks too much, the third tells lies and half truths. It is only through this silence that the women are able to wield any power, something the psychiatrist begins to appreciate as she too becomes aware of the suffocation and suppression within her marriage and the male judicial system within which she works. Much has been made of the closing scenes, which have to be seen to be believed. Cast includes Cox Habbema, Nelly Fridja, Henriette Tol and Eddy Brugman. In Dutch with English subtitles.

results.title: Question of prejudice
results.brief_description: A study of the racist atitudes of some Australians toward migrant Australians, highligting the ‘wog’ syndrome. Investigtes the discrimination shown in the workforce towards groups such as the Lebanese, and its human effects such as the loss of self-esteem. Includes the views of Robert Cameron (White Australia Movement) and children.
